metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1423 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: signond before 8.57+15.04.20141127.1-0ubuntu1, as used in Ubuntu Touch, did not properly restrict applications from querying oath tokens due to incorrect checks and the missing installation of the signon-apparmor-extension. An attacker could use this create a malicious click app that collects oauth tokens for other applications, exposing sensitive information.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This is fixed in vivid. Setting to low priority for trusty and utopic since it is specific to click apps.

criterions.comment: signon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
